Flag draped coffins of slain Palestinians killed in Israeli raid are taken through the streets of Beirut, Lebanon on April 12, 1973, during the funeral procession. The Israeli commando force led by a man disguised as brunette, Ehud Barak, who later rose to become Israel’s prime minister infiltrated a posh Beirut neighborhood shooting dead three top officials with the Palestine Liberation Organization in two separate adjacent buildings.
